original_title: Sri Lanka legislator Aluthgamage’s ‘travel ban’ a data error
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka ruling party, Podujana Peramuna member Mahindananada Aluthgamage was prevented from going abroad at the airport due to a data entry error, the Department of Immigration and Emigration said.
On March 10, the airport emigration department prevented MP Aluthgamage from boarding a flight, saying that the Mathugama court had issued a foreign travel ban on him.
“The situation arose due to information about a third party who is under a travel ban being entered under MP Aluthgamage’s passport details in the system,” a statement from the department said.

The officer who entered the information into the system has been interdicted, and an investigation is being carried out by the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT), the statement said.
Aluthgamage was later quoted as saying that he will take legal actions against the department. (Colombo/March 13/2023)
